name: retroassembly
description: RetroAssembly is a self-hosted web-based IDE for writing assembly programs. It supports syntax highlighting, debugging, and multi-platform code support in a retro-style UI.
features: Web-based IDE: Write and edit assembly code directly in your browser without local tools.
Syntax highlighting: Color-coded assembly instructions for improved readability.
Multi-architecture support: Write code for x86, ARM, MIPS, and other processor architectures.
Real-time assembly: See machine code output as you type assembly instructions.
Debugging tools: Step through code execution and inspect register values.
Code examples: Learn from built-in examples demonstrating common assembly patterns.
Export functionality: Download assembled binaries or hex dumps for use elsewhere.
Retro aesthetics: Enjoy a nostalgic terminal-style interface reminiscent of classic computers.
Keyboard shortcuts: Navigate and edit code efficiently with customizable hotkeys.
Error highlighting: Identify syntax errors and invalid instructions immediately.
Register visualization: Monitor CPU register states during code execution.
Shareable links: Share code snippets with others via URLs for collaboration or teaching.
